title: So Gangplank's Glowing Weapon is the Crimson-Coil Dagger?

replies.body:
Gangplank uses a cutlass.

The dagger is unrelated to his flaming cutlass I would assume
The dagger was the one Twisted Fate stole, not his normal blade...

But the dagger is very large as seen in the Act 1 - Explore the World picture. I'm not even sure why its called a dagger due to its size. 

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sYeKCZ3HTus/Va7WmFExRkI/AAAAAAAAFJI/G1pInpMu7fY/s1600/act-1-world-layer-base.jpg

Magic dagger + blood

Well

I'm no expert on this, but that looks like some kind of summoning ritual. But what does it summon? Let's hope that it's not the Mother Serpent...
And suddenly Gangplank's ultimate summons Vel'koz's older brother instead of a global cannon shot.
Nah, not gonna happen. After all the dagger is lost now, no? ^^
As I stated in another thread, this event still awaits it's conclusion. ^^ I personally expect a cinematic...

Totally agree!

But I think the dagger fell into the water, maybe Naut found it? Maybe GP found it? Maybe there's some tie-in between GP and Naut and Nami or something.

Maybe GP's Sion.
I think something else down there was already waiting for it to come down... We will see when the event concludes... ^^

What if this brings in Baron Nashor?

GP becomes a void creature?
Nah, the only weird thing that could happen is him being really dead, getting revived at the isles and then lead the Harrowing as a boss on zombie pirates. But not going to happen I guess...
